pros: Good work/life balance. Good benefits. Nice coworkers. Opportunity to be "entrepreneurial," take on more work/responsibilities, and be recognized for that. Org genuinely cares about employee experience and tries to improve.
cons: Lower pay compared to for-profit orgs. Health insurance benefits are ok but not amazing. Some managers in assessment division have a "sink or swim" attitude towards staff, though this has worked out fine for me personally.

pros: Decent Salary, flexibility with scheduling, work from home option on a case by case basis. Great colleagues with mutual goals. Do you like bagels? Well every Wednesday you get to indulge yourself in a wide variety of bagels. Every...Wednesday.
cons:
Management is all over the place. For starters, they are unresponsive. They are quick to jump on you indirectly. Meaning, if they have an issue, you won't find out through them, you will find out through your "Team lead". Management seems constantly intimidated, and refuse to admit their own wrong doing. Also, management once again hates confrontation. If you have an issue, go through your team lead. Notice a pattern? You're right! Team leads are basically the managers, and actual management hide behind their desk, and don't really cooperate with you.

The interview has 6 people involved, The manager, either 1 or both of the managers below her, and 3-4 Team leads of their respective teams. They will ask you questions based off of your Resume, and they will ask you questions irrelevant to the job. The position will be advertised as a full-on/hands-on technical position, but in reality, it is a call-center, phone based interaction environment. 

The job consists of a month long training ordeal. You learn the systems, the different aspects of the department, and of course the awful ticketing system. You receive tickets, you scramble around to figure it out, you get some other employees who are literal "know it all's" telling you to do this and do that. By the end of the day, you reflect on the work you've done, and just laugh.

Beware of "slow days". Management finds it amusing putting on skits/plays, thinking it builds team moral, and bonding. In reality the plays and skits develop separation, and negative outlooks of the company/job. Time management is not an issue, there will be days where you go into the office, sit there, google this and that, and go home, If you milk the job right, you won't have a ticket for 8-10 weeks. What a deal! 

Though there are a lot of cons, the other employees made the stay at A.I.R. a decent one. I do not recommend this company, I recommend saving your time interviewing with another company.

review_title: Better Opportunities Out There - Tier 2 Support
job_title: Tier II Agent in Reston, VA
pros: Not too many pros that I can think of for this company. The pay is good and you get flexible schedules. If you like carbs, they'll have bagels every Wednesday so you could load up.
cons: Poor management team. Management is typically unresponsive and seemingly busy ALL the time. If you had any concerns or issues, you will have to go indirectly through your lead even if it is personal. Teams are divided by an unspoken "competition" with each other and low level employees try to micromanage another team's members. The prospect of being hired on is slim to none for this position since the job is seasonal (they support education). The interview consists of 5-6 employees + manager. They will ask you a combination of questions completely irrelevant to their actual tier 2 support based off of your resume. Any additional questions they have will be off of the internet. Your experience will be that of a call center with no interaction with hardware/software that you should get from tier 2 support. So if you're looking for any growth with an enterprise Windows/Mac/Linux environment, this is not the place. Most employees are unhappy, so the environment can and most likely will bring down your mood before you leave for the day. Your title will be constantly changing, so you better pay attention. The job is call center.

review_title: Work here only if you have no other option
